objects.description:
Monitor for newly executed processes that may be indicative of credential dumping. On Windows 8.1 and Windows Server 2012 R2, monitor Windows Logs for LSASS.exe creation to verify that LSASS started as a protected process. Try monitoring for Sysmon Event ID 1 and/or Windows Security Event ID 4688 for process activity. Note: Rundll32/MiniDump has a different command-line syntax than that of Procdump, in that the process being dumped is specified via process ID instead of name (as with Procdump). Therefore, because the LSASS process ID is non-deterministic, the MiniDump detection isn’t specific to LSASS dumping and may need to be tuned to help reduce false positives.

Analytic 1 - Procdump

processes = filter processes where ((event_id == "1" OR event_id == "4688") AND exe == "procdump*.exe" and command_line == "*lsass*")

Analytic 2 - MiniDump via rundll32

processes = filter processes where ((event_id == "1" OR event_id == "4688") AND exe == "*rundll32.exe" and command_line == "*comsvcs.dll MiniDump*")
